llama2_direct_sole-planning_results:
Great! Based on your requirements, here's a suggested travel plan for your trip from Detroit to San Diego:

Day 1 (March 5th):

* Departure from Detroit: Take a taxi or self-driving car to the Detroit Metropolitan Wayne County Airport (DTW) for your flight to San Diego.
* Flight from Detroit to San Diego: Fly from Detroit to San Diego on March 5th around 2 pm (flight number F3519973, price $968).
* Arrival in San Diego: Arrive at San Diego International Airport (SAN) around 4 pm.
* Check-in at Hotel: Take a taxi or Uber to your hotel in downtown San Diego and check-in. We recommend staying at the Hyatt Regency San Diego Downtown (around $150 per night).
* Dinner: Head to the Gaslamp Quarter for dinner. You can try some local cuisine like fish tacos or a slice of pizza at one of the many restaurants in the area.

Day 2 (March 6th):

* Breakfast: Start your day with breakfast at a nearby café.
* Attractions: Visit some of San Diego's famous attractions like the Balboa Park, the San Diego Zoo, or take a harbor cruise to see the city from the water. You can also visit the USS Midway Museum or check out the local street art in the neighborhoods of Barrio Logan and North Park.
* Lunch: Grab some lunch at one of the many food trucks or restaurants around the city.
* Beach Time: Spend some time relaxing on a nearby beach like La Jolla Cove or Mission Beach.
* Dinner: Head back to downtown San Diego for dinner and explore more of the city's culinary scene.

Day 3 (March 7th):

* Check-out from Hotel: Check out of your hotel around 11 am.
* Flight from San Diego to Detroit: Fly from San Diego to Detroit on March 7th around 10 am (flight number F3528556, price $875).
* Departure from Detroit: Take a taxi or self-driving car back to the Detroit Metropolitan Wayne County Airport (DTW) for your departure.

Budget Breakdown:

* Flights: $1,803 ($968 x 2 flights)
* Hotel: $150 per night x 3 nights = $450
* Food and Activities: $100 per day x 3 days = $300
Total Budget: $3,153

Note: Prices are approximate and can vary based on availability and seasonality. Also, please check the latest travel requirements and restrictions before your trip.
